verses.verse: In the third<WH7969> year<WH8141> of the reign<WH4438> of king<WH4428> Belshazzar<WH1112> a vision<WH2377> appeared<WH7200> unto me<WH1840>, even unto me Daniel, after<WH310> that which appeared<WH7200> unto me at the first<WH8462>.

And I saw<WH7200> in a vision<WH2377>; and it came to pass<WH7200>, when I saw, that I was at Shushan<WH7800> in the palace<WH1002>, which is in the province<WH4082> of Elam<WH5867>; and I saw<WH7200> in a vision<WH2377>, and I was by the river<WH180> of Ulai<WH195>.

Then I lifted up<WH5375> my eyes<WH5869>, and saw<WH7200>, and<WH5975>, behold, there stood before<WH6440> the river<WH180> a<WH259> ram<WH352> which had two horns<WH7161>: and the two horns<WH7161> were high<WH1364>; but one<WH259> was higher<WH1364> than the other<WH8145>, and the higher<WH1364> came up<WH5927> last<WH314>.

I saw<WH7200> the ram<WH352> pushing<WH5055> westward<WH3220>, and northward<WH6828>, and southward<WH5045>; so that no animals<WH2416> might stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> him<WH5337>, neither was there any that could deliver out of his hand<WH3027>; but he did<WH6213> according to his will<WH7522>, and became great<WH1431>.

And as I was considering<WH995>, behold<WH5795>, a he goat<WH6842> came<WH935> from the west<WH4628> on the face<WH6440> of the whole earth<WH776>, and touched<WH5060> not the ground<WH776>: and the goat<WH6842> had a notable<WH2380> horn<WH7161> between his eyes<WH5869>.

And he came<WH935> to the ram<WH352> that had<WH1167> two horns<WH7161>, which I had seen<WH7200> standing<WH5975> before<WH6440> the river<WH180>, and ran<WH7323> unto him in the fury<WH2534> of his power<WH3581>.

And I saw<WH7200> him come<WH5060> close unto<WH681> the ram<WH352>, and he was moved with anger<WH4843> against him<WH5221>, and struck the ram<WH352>, and broke<WH7665> his two<WH8147> horns<WH7161>: and there was no power<WH3581> in the ram<WH352> to stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> him<WH7993>, but he cast him down to the ground<WH776>, and stamped<WH7429> upon him<WH5337>: and there was none that could deliver the ram<WH352> out of his hand<WH3027>.

Therefore the he<WH6842> goat<WH5795> grew very<WH3966> great<WH1431>: and when he was strong<WH6105>, the great<WH1419> horn<WH7161> was broken<WH7665>; and for it came up<WH5927> four<WH702> notable ones<WH2380> toward the four<WH702> winds<WH7307> of heaven<WH8064>.

And out of one<WH259> of them came forth<WH3318> a little<WH4704> horn<WH7161>, which grew exceedingly<WH3499> great<WH1431>, toward the south<WH5045>, and toward the east<WH4217>, and toward the pleasant land<WH6643>.
And it grew great<WH1431>, even to the army<WH6635> of heaven<WH8064>; and it cast down<WH5307> some of the army<WH6635> and of the stars<WH3556> to the ground<WH776>, and stamped upon them<WH7429>.

Yes<WH1431>, he magnified himself even to the prince<WH8269> of the army<WH6635>, and by him the daily<WH8548> sacrifice was taken away<WH7311>, and the place<WH4349> of his sanctuary<WH4720> was cast down<WH7993>.

And a army<WH6635> was given<WH5414> him against the daily<WH8548> sacrifice by reason of transgression<WH6588>, and it cast down<WH7993> the truth<WH571> to the ground<WH776>; and it practised<WH6213>, and prospered<WH6743>.

Then I heard<WH8085> one<WH259> saint<WH6918> speaking<WH1696>, and another<WH259> saint<WH6918> said<WH559> unto that certain<WH6422> saint which spoke<WH1696>, How long shall be the vision<WH2377> concerning the daily<WH8548> sacrifice<WH6588>, and the transgression of desolation<WH8074>, to give<WH5414> both the sanctuary<WH6944> and the army<WH6635> to be trodden under foot<WH4823>?
And he said<WH559> unto me<WH505>, Unto two thousand and three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> days<WH6153>; then shall the sanctuary<WH6944> be cleansed<WH6663>.

And it came to pass<WH1840>, when I, even I Daniel, had seen<WH7200> the vision<WH2377>, and sought<WH1245> for the meaning<WH998>, then<WH5975>, behold, there stood before me as the appearance<WH4758> of a man<WH1397>.

And I heard<WH8085> a man<WH120>'s voice<WH6963> between the banks of Ulai<WH195>, which called<WH7121>, and said<WH559>, Gabriel<WH1403>, make this<WH1975> man to understand<WH995> the vision<WH4758>.

So he came<WH935> near<WH681> where I stood<WH5977>: and when he came<WH935>, I was afraid<WH1204>, and fell<WH5307> upon my face<WH6440>: but he said<WH559> unto me<WH995>, Understand, O son<WH1121> of man<WH120>: for at the time<WH6256> of the end<WH7093> shall be the vision<WH2377>.
Now as he was speaking<WH1696> with me<WH7290>, I was in a deep sleep on my face<WH6440> toward the ground<WH776>: but he touched<WH5060> me<WH5975>, and set me upright<WH5977>.
And he said<WH559>, Behold<WH3045>, I will make you know what shall be in the last end<WH319> of the indignation<WH2195>: for at the time appointed<WH4150> the end shall be<WH7093>.
The ram<WH352> which you saw<WH7200> having<WH1167> two horns<WH7161> are the kings<WH4428> of Media<WH4074> and Persia<WH6539>.
And the rough<WH8163> goat<WH6842> is the king<WH4428> of Grecia<WH3120>: and the great<WH1419> horn<WH7161> that is between his eyes<WH5869> is the first<WH7223> king<WH4428>.
Now that being broken<WH7665>, whereas four<WH702> stood up<WH5975> for it<WH702>, four kingdoms<WH4438> shall stand up<WH5975> out of the nation<WH1471>, but not in his power<WH3581>.

And in the latter time<WH319> of their kingdom<WH4438>, when the transgressors<WH6586> are come to the full<WH8552>, a king<WH4428> of fierce<WH5794> face<WH6440>, and understanding<WH995> dark sentences<WH2420>, shall stand up<WH5975>.

And his power<WH3581> shall be mighty<WH6105>, but not by his own power<WH3581>: and he shall destroy<WH7843> wonderfully<WH6381>, and shall prosper<WH6743>, and practice<WH6213>, and shall destroy<WH7843> the mighty<WH6099> and the holy<WH6918> people<WH5971>.

And through his policy<WH7922> also he shall cause craft<WH4820> to prosper<WH6743> in his hand<WH3027>; and he shall magnify<WH1431> himself in his heart<WH3824>, and by peace<WH7962> shall destroy<WH7843> many<WH7227>: he shall also stand up<WH5975> against the Prince<WH8269> of princes<WH8269>; but he shall be broken<WH7665> without<WH657> hand<WH3027>.
And the vision<WH4758> of the evening<WH6153> and the morning<WH1242> which was told<WH559> is true<WH571>: therefore shut up the vision<WH2377>; for it is for many<WH7227> days from now<WH3117>.

And I Daniel<WH1840> fainted<WH1961>, and was sick<WH2470> certain days<WH3117>; afterward I rose up<WH6965>, and did<WH6213> the king<WH4428>'s business<WH4399>; and I was astonished<WH8074> at the vision<WH4758>, but none understood it<WH995>.
